Pollution control expert Jo Bradley explores the challenges of poisoning road runoff & the solutions. Its payload of microplastic tyre wear particles & heavy metals damage our #chalkstreams & rivers. Book your FREE place. Wed 24 Feb, all welcome. https://t.co/0fSAOMpNC9 https://t.co/9S53vfpnZz

urls.title: You are invited to join a Chalk Aquifer Alliance talk by Jo Bradley "Is this the road to Hell: what is road runoff doing to our rivers & streams?" After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the webinar.
urls.description: A Chalk Aquifer Alliance event, hosted by Bury Water Meadows Group Jo Bradley will describe the problem of pollution from road runoff and provide some examples of data and polluting outfalls. She will explain what solutions are available and how they should be funded and operated. Then Jo will outline some of the emerging research on the pollution from tyre wear particles and the effect it may be having on wildlife & humans. Jo hopes that by discussing this topic with the CAA, she can understand the impact on Chalk Streams better, and begin to identify priority locations for improvements to be made on the Chalk Streams.
